message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "This analysis draws on data from the World Bank Enterprise Surveys and the Global Entrepreneurship Monitor to examine the relationship between informal entrepreneurship and firm performance.", "dataset": ["World Bank Enterprise Surveys", "Global Entrepreneurship Monitor"], "topic": ["Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "We used data from the Demographic and Health Survey along with a matched user survey to clarify the reasons for the low use of maternal health services in Nigeria despite improved supply-side conditions.", "dataset": ["Demographic and Health Survey"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This study merges household level survey data from the Tanzania National Panel Survey with data from Tanzania's unified agriculture survey to investigate the determinants of fertilizer adoption among Tanzanian smallholder farmers.", "dataset": ["Tanzania National Panel Survey", "Tanzania's unified agriculture survey"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food"]}, {"sentence": "Using panel data from the Bangladesh Economic Census covering a period of over 15 years, we analyze how both spatial and aggregate trends affect industrial diversity patterns.", "dataset": ["Bangladesh Economic Census"], "topic": ["Competitiveness"]}, {"sentence": "In this paper, we provide a comprehensive estimate of local temperature responses for crop yields through massive data combination, synthesizing findings from six different empirical strategies that include geographically weighted regression, high-dimensional fixed effect models, A/B testing, difference-in-difference methods, and structural modeling, based on a dataset of global gridded weather and crop yield data.", "dataset": ["global gridded weather and crop yield data"], "topic": ["Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We assess changes in air quality across India due to the reduction in sulfur emissions from power plants, using satellite-derived aerosol optical depth measurements, ground-based monitoring data, and atmospheric model simulations.", "dataset": ["satellite-derived aerosol optical depth measurements", "ground-based monitoring data"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "Using cross-sectional data from the China Family Panel Studies, we explore the relationship between parental education and child's health outcomes, taking into account the role of health insurance coverage and maternal mental health status.", "dataset": ["China Family Panel Studies"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper combines a firm-level dataset from the World Bank Enterprise Surveys with disaggregated product code trade data to advance our understanding on how services liberalization may affect firms' decisions and economic performance.", "dataset": ["World Bank Enterprise Surveys", "disaggregated product code trade data"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "We use a novel dataset that links information on internet access usage, telecommunications infrastructure, and firm-level data from the World Bank Enterprise Surveys to study the relationship between access to digital technologies and firm performance.", "dataset": ["World Bank Enterprise Surveys"], "topic": ["Digital Development"]}, {"sentence": "In this paper, we use fine-grained data at the disaggregated product level to identify the mechanisms by which input tariffs affect the productivity of firms using data from French Customs and VAT returns along with confidential customs data at the firm-product level.", "dataset": ["French Customs and VAT returns", "confidential customs data at the firm-product level"], "topic": ["Trade"]}]
